result.execSummary:
The defendant William B. Beaudry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$180.00 buy money, paid from money on deposit.
Work out payment plan with agent.

No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Maintain absolute sobriety to include no possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, intoxicating substances or any other controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known where drugs can be obtained illegally.
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
Work out payment plan with agent.

timeConds.notes:
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
Defendant to receive huber release for treatment purposes also.
Provide DNA sample on 2-28-17.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William B. Beaudry in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Allen R Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1pm
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms 
Atty Smith spks on PSI corrections
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Smith spks on sentencing
Def addresses the court
Court imposes:
Imposed and stayed: 4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision. Eligible for SAP. Not eligible for CIP.
4 years probation:
10 months jail with huber release, if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. Report to jail by 7pm on 2-28-17. Def to receive huber release for treatment purposes also.
Pay costs, fees, DNA & $180 buy money--$180 buy money has been paid, work out payment plan with agent 
120 hours of community service
Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
No entrance into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Maintain absolute sobriety; no possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, intoxicating substances or any other controlled substance without a valid prescription
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers, or places known where drugs can be obtained illegally
Maintain full-time employment
Def must give DNA sample on 2-28-17
